common_issues.title: PiecesOS fails to launch after update
common_issues.description: Users report PiecesOS failing to launch after updating to version 11.1.1. The issue seems to stem from stricter hardware requirements, particularly related to AVX2 support. The Pieces team is aware of the problem and is actively working on a patch. A fix is expected to be released soon.

related_issues.title: PiecesOS crash immediately after launch
related_issues.text:
PiecesOS crash immediately after launch
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

After upgrade PiecesOS to version 11.1..1 it crashes every time immediately after launch. Previous version worked well. Attached is the crash report log.

Environment: 

- OS MacOS 15.2
- CPU Intel 

[trace.log](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/18777512/trace.log)
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points:**

* @gonzososa reported an issue with PiecesOS not launching on macOS.
* The issue seems related to AVX2 issues in the new vector library.
* The Pieces team is actively working on a solution and expects to release a fix soon.

**Problems Identified:**

* PiecesOS was unable to launch on macOS, likely due to AVX2 incompatibility.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* The Pieces team is working on a fix for the AVX2 issues.
* They requested information about @gonzososa's CPU to assist with debugging.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue is still ongoing, but a fix is expected to be released soon.

**Additional Information:**

* The conversation suggests that other users have reported similar issues.
* The Pieces team provided helpful resources for troubleshooting and documentation.

related_issues.title: Pieces os doesn't launch at all for past week. Can't use pieces at all
related_issues.text:
Pieces os doesn't launch at all for past week. Can't use pieces at all
### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

For the past week, anytime that I launch pieces I see this: 

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/61f18fb6-8846-46d8-8747-5c415fd2e82d)

Pieces OS just doesn't open, no matter what.

I tried to reinstall everything, but also no progress.

How to fix it? (Also to mention, Pieces desktop app is in Early Access program, but I don't know if this information is useful)
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points:**

* User `GetReal444` reported an issue with booting up the Pieces app.
* The issue seems related to a database service error.
* An error message mentioning "AVX2 not supported on this processor" was identified.
* This issue is affecting more users than initially expected.
* The issue is related to a hardware requirement on the database service.

**Problems Identified:**

* The Pieces app is failing to boot up for some users.
* The error is related to AVX2 not being supported on the user's processor.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* The Pieces team is actively working on a solution.
* A patch is expected to be released within the next 24-48 hours (as of February 11, 2025).

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue is still ongoing.
* A fix is expected to be released soon.

**Additional Information:**

* The issue is related to an failing dependency of avx2 vector library on certain platforms.
* A release with a fix is expected to go out by EOD on February 13, 2025.

**Note:** This summary is based on the information available as of February 13, 2025. The situation may have changed since then.

related_issues.title: PiecesOS was unable to launch.
related_issues.text:
PiecesOS was unable to launch.
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

latest

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/7a6a7957-5aa1-4d53-b492-cf4470aa5edc)
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key points raised:**

* Users are experiencing issues with Pieces OS version 11.1.1, specifically the app not launching.
* The problem seems related to stricter hardware requirements.
* The community identified workarounds and provided details on how to collect relevant logs.

**Problems identified:**

* Pieces OS version 11.1.1 has issues with certain hardware configurations, causing the app not to launch.
* Difficulty diagnosing the issue without user-provided logs.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* The Pieces team is actively working on a patch to resolve the issue within 24-48 hours.
* Users are encouraged to provide support logs for further analysis.
* A new release is planned for the end of the day (2025-02-13) to address the problem.

**Current status/outcome:**

* The issue is being actively addressed by the Pieces team.
* A fix is expected to be released soon.
* Users are encouraged to update to the new release once available.

**Additional notes:**

* This issue is related to #625, which also discusses the app not launching problem.
* The Pieces team is highly appreciative of user patience and assistance in resolving the issue. 

**Overall, the conversation highlights the importance of user community involvement in identifying and resolving technical issues.**

common_issues.title: PiecesOS launch failures after version 11.1.1 update
common_issues.description: Users report PiecesOS failing to launch after updating to version 11.1.1, across macOS and Windows. Issues seem related to hardware compatibility, particularly AVX2 support and architecture-specific builds (ARM/Intel). The Pieces team is actively working on patches and encouraging users to provide logs for analysis.

related_issues.title: Cannot launch pieces-for-developers after new installation on MacOS Sequoia 15.2 M1 chip
related_issues.text:
Cannot launch pieces-for-developers after new installation on MacOS Sequoia 15.2 M1 chip
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I cannot install pieces Desktop App, or it fails to run.  I originally reported this by email on 9 Jan 2025, and the response email referred to an existing issue on github #546.  However this issue now seems closed, hence I am raising it here as a new bug.
 
I have recently installed pieces OS on my Mac with a package dmg.  The pieces OS appears to install, and I see the icon in the top bar.  Pieces appears to connect to the cloud successfully, and I can install plugins for Intellij, VSCode and Obsidian.  These are visible within the pieces OS icon at the top.  
 
Pieces appears to work from IDE plugins.   However I cannot launch the Desktop App, and ‘launch pieces for developers’ from the top Pieces menu fails silently.

I have recently upgraded Pieces OS, now on 11.1.1
 
Info:
 
Mac OS: Sequoia 15.2
Chip: Apple M1 Pro
 
Pieces OS: 11.1.1 (was installed as 11.0.3(
Pieces desktop app – won’t install
Pieces OS seems to be running in ‘activity monitor’
## Summary of Conversation: GitHub Issue #621

**Issue:**

PASimmons encountered an error launching Pieces OS on their M1 chip Mac. 

**Key Points Raised:**

* User had previously encountered a similar issue (#615) which was resolved.
* User confirmed they were using the appropriate Silicon version for their M1 Mac.
* User provided support logs as requested.
* Logs revealed a service constraint issue requiring specific builds for Intel and ARM architectures.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Mark-at-pieces requested the user:
    * Kill any running Pieces processes.
    * Provide support logs.
    * Verify the correct architecture (ARM/Intel) for their Mac.
    * Reinstall Pieces using the provided Mac Silicon download link.
* User completed the requested steps.
* Mark-at-pieces confirmed that the issue was resolved and referenced the ongoing announcement in #615. 

**Current Status/Outcome:**

The issue has been resolved. The user successfully launched Pieces OS after reinstalling the correct architecture version.

**Important Detail:** 

Service constraints now require separate builds for ARM and Intel architectures. Users need to ensure they have the appropriate version for their specific device.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS and Desktop App Bugs and Fixes
common_issues.description: Users reported various bugs including slow boot-up, unresponsive app, and eager saving. These issues were often related to specific OS versions or updates. Solutions included patches, new builds, and workarounds like disabling on-screen keyboards. The Pieces team actively addressed these issues, releasing fixes and updates to improve user experience.

related_issues.title: Conversation titles save too eagerly while editing
related_issues.text:
Conversation titles save too eagerly while editing
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.4

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

When I click on the title of Conversation in the Desktop app, I can edit it as expected but it will update save the input before I'm done editing.
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points:**

* User @seantiz reported an issue with renaming conversations in Pieces on 2025-01-17.
* @mack-at-pieces acknowledged the issue and confirmed similar behavior.
* A patch was released for the copilot and desktop app on 2025-02-10 (v3.3.5 and 3.3.6).
* On 2025-02-11, @seantiz confirmed the issue was resolved after updating to the new version.

**Problems Identified:**

* Users were experiencing odd behavior when renaming conversations.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* A patch was released for the copilot and desktop app to address the issue.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue with renaming conversations has been resolved.

related_issues.title: PiecesOS takes a while to boot-up(cannot run): (Unable to make it past ensure core dependency in the Desktop application)
related_issues.text:
PiecesOS takes a while to boot-up(cannot run): (Unable to make it past ensure core dependency in the Desktop application)
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

3.3.5

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I got a popup that there was a new version of Pieces OS and that I needed to click and restart to update. But now the desktop app won't start anymore, being stuck on the core dependencies.

I can click on the link, but nothing changes when I do that.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/716af38b-6a71-4162-80f8-b9e9e44f7059)
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation: PiecesOS takes too long to boot

**Key Points Raised:**

* Users are experiencing delays in PiecesOS startup, sometimes taking up to several hours.
* The issue appears to be related to the migration of data from the previous stack to the new stack during the 11.1.0 update.
* Users are also reporting issues with the systray icon disappearing and PFD not being able to connect.

**Problems Identified:**

* Slow startup time for PiecesOS due to data migration.
* Systray icon disappearing and PFD connection issues.
* Conflicting issue with OneDrive interfering with PiecesOS files.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* The Pieces team released a new build (11.1.1) with a fix for the data migration issue.
* Users are advised to update to the latest version and restart their systems.
* In case of OneDrive conflicts, users are advised to either contact support or remove the com.pieces.os folder from their OneDrive/Documents location.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The data migration issue has been resolved in the latest build (11.1.1).
* Some users are still experiencing issues with the systray icon and PFD connection.
* The OneDrive conflict issue has been identified and a solution is being implemented in the next build.

**Additional Notes:**

* The issue primarily affects Windows users.
* The Pieces team is actively working to resolve any remaining issues.
* Users are encouraged to update to the latest build and contact support if they continue to experience problems.

 ## Conclusion

The data migration issue causing slow startup times for PiecesOS has been resolved. However, some users are still experiencing issues with the systray icon and PFD connection. The Pieces team is actively working to address these remaining problems and will be releasing a fix in the next build.

related_issues.title: [Linux Mint] Pieces app goes unresponsive on opening and every 5sec. Can't use it at all in any way
related_issues.text:
[Linux Mint] Pieces app goes unresponsive on opening and every 5sec. Can't use it at all in any way
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Pieces app goes unresponsive and freezes a lot when trying to do anything, like trying to type in copilot chat or navigating through the menus. Can't use pieces app at all! Tried reinstalling it, but it made no difference. Desktop app version is 3.3.6

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/e75595c0-31c8-4560-b08b-9ad3de8af6ab
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points Raised:**

* Pieces app freezing on Linux Mint
* Issue related to TextFields and specific Linux Mint versions
* Workaround: Disabling on-screen keyboard

**Problems Identified:**

* Pieces app freezing and unresponsiveness
* Caused by a known Flutter issue (GitHub issue #153560)

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Disabling the on-screen keyboard as a workaround
* Hotfix for the Flutter issue expected soon

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Issue closed
* Workaround solves the issue for the user
* Long-term fix expected with future Flutter releases

common_issues.title: Pieces OS fails to launch on version 11.1.1
common_issues.description: Users are reporting that Pieces OS version 11.1.1 is failing to launch on both Windows and Linux operating systems. The issue seems to stem from stricter hardware requirements, particularly related to AVX2 processor support. The Pieces team is aware of the problem and is actively working on a patch. A new release addressing this issue is expected to be available soon.

Faccing "DatabaseException(Unable to load 'CouchbaseLiteVectorSearch' extenstion" (1), code : can'tOpenFile)" on my ubuntu desktop 
## Summary of GitHub issue conversation

**Key points:**

* User @Rohit0072 reported an issue booting up the Pieces app.
* The issue was automatically routed to the relevant team member.
* @Rohit0072 was provided with links to similar issues, resources, and contact information.
* @mark-at-pieces offered further assistance and contact details.

**Problems identified:**

* The Pieces app was not booting up properly.
* This issue was also reported in other threads.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* A solution was expected to be released within 24 hours.
* @tsavo-at-pieces announced an upcoming release to fix the booting issue and potentially related problems.

**Current status/outcome:**

* A solution is expected to be released soon.
* The user was encouraged to contact the support team for further assistance.

**Additional notes:**

* The issue is related to several other reported problems.
* The team is actively working on a solution.

common_issues.title: PiecesOS Launch Issues on MacOS
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing issues launching PiecesOS on MacOS after updating to recent versions, particularly on M1/M2 Macs and systems without AVX2 support. The problems often stem from installing the incorrect architecture version (Intel vs. ARM) or incompatibilities with the new vector library. Solutions include reinstalling the correct version, ensuring AVX2 support, and waiting for upcoming bug fixes from the Pieces team.

related_issues.title: Unable to Boot PiecesOS on Macos(Arm architecture) After updating to 11.1.0
related_issues.text: Unable to Boot PiecesOS on Macos(Arm architecture) After updating to 11.1.0 If you cannot open PiecesOS after updating to 11.1.0 and you are on an arm Machine M1, M2, M3,...etc then it is likely that you accidentally installed the intel version of the application. If you are Unsure. Please uninstall Pieces OS from your applications folder and reinstall from https://docs.pieces.app/installation-getting-started/macos (Arm == Apple Silicon) You can tell if you are working with Arm architecture if you see something that resembles this within your 'About this Mac' If you are still having issues after trying these steps please feel free to add a comment on this issue and schedule a time on my calendar here. https://calendar.app.google/MGd9i5gELtiDjWZm8 No comments found on this issue.

related_issues.title: Cannot launch pieces-for-developers after new installation on MacOS Sequoia 15.2 M1 chip
related_issues.text:
Cannot launch pieces-for-developers after new installation on MacOS Sequoia 15.2 M1 chip
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I cannot install pieces Desktop App, or it fails to run.  I originally reported this by email on 9 Jan 2025, and the response email referred to an existing issue on github #546.  However this issue now seems closed, hence I am raising it here as a new bug.
 
I have recently installed pieces OS on my Mac with a package dmg.  The pieces OS appears to install, and I see the icon in the top bar.  Pieces appears to connect to the cloud successfully, and I can install plugins for Intellij, VSCode and Obsidian.  These are visible within the pieces OS icon at the top.  
 
Pieces appears to work from IDE plugins.   However I cannot launch the Desktop App, and ‘launch pieces for developers’ from the top Pieces menu fails silently.

I have recently upgraded Pieces OS, now on 11.1.1
 
Info:
 
Mac OS: Sequoia 15.2
Chip: Apple M1 Pro
 
Pieces OS: 11.1.1 (was installed as 11.0.3(
Pieces desktop app – won’t install
Pieces OS seems to be running in ‘activity monitor’
## Summary of Conversation: GitHub Issue #621

**Issue:**

PASimmons encountered an error launching Pieces OS on their M1 chip Mac. 

**Key Points Raised:**

* User had previously encountered a similar issue (#615) which was resolved.

**Important Detail:**

recommendations: "**Prioritize resolving PiecesOS launch failures:** The most frequent and active support tickets revolve around PiecesOS failing to launch after the 11.1.1 update, particularly due to AVX2 support and architecture-specific issues. Focus on resolving these issues urgently to reduce ticket volume."

"**Improve communication about hardware requirements:** Clearly communicate the updated hardware requirements for PiecesOS 11.1.1, especially AVX2 support, on the download page, installation instructions, and release notes. This will help users avoid installation issues."

"**Provide troubleshooting steps for launch issues:** Create a comprehensive troubleshooting guide for PiecesOS launch failures, covering common problems like AVX2 incompatibility, incorrect architecture versions, and potential workarounds. This will empower users to self-resolve issues."

"**Investigate and address Linux Mint freezing:**  Address the issue of the Pieces app freezing on Linux Mint, which is a recurring problem. While a workaround exists, a permanent fix is crucial for a better user experience."

"**Monitor and address high CPU usage on Linux Mint:** Investigate reports of high CPU usage by Pieces OS on Linux Mint 22.1. Identify the root cause and implement optimizations to improve performance and resource utilization."
